title: Boston Crime Data Classification and Reporting Practices (2020–2025

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Boston Crime Data Classification and Reporting Practices (2020–2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

This request relates to public statements and data reported in the Boston Globe on March 4, 2025 (https://www.bostonglobe.com/2025/03/04/metro/boston-police-data-crime-declines/), which state:
Homicides fell from 56 in 2020 to 24 in 2024
Shootings dropped from 274 in 2020 to 129 in 2024
Robbery and aggravated assault remained relatively steady
Larceny and other property crimes saw a marginal increase
Downtown Boston experienced elevated larceny and robbery rates compared to prior years


To better understand how incidents are tracked and classified, I request:

1. Internal policies, manuals, or memos (2020–present) defining crime classification thresholds, especially for homicides, shootings, aggravated assaults, robbery, and larceny.
2. Documentation of any changes to crime coding or reporting methodology between 2020 and 2025.
3. A list or summary of reclassified or downgraded incidents during that period.
4. Any internal audits or reviews related to the accuracy or methodology of published crime statistics.
5. Anonymized CAD (Computer-Aided Dispatch) logs for 2024 and 2025 for comparison with official statistics.
6. Copies of Boston’s UCR or NIBRS submissions to the FBI for the years 2020–2025.
7. Copies of any email correspondence from January 1, 2023, to March 5, 2025, between BPD staff, the Mayor’s Office, or any City of Boston communications personnel discussing the preparation, presentation, or framing of crime statistics released to the public or media—including but not limited to the data cited in the Boston Globe on March 4, 2025.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Public Records Request – Deltona Middle School SRO Assault (November 19, 2024)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Deltona Middle School SRO Assault (November 19, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

On the morning of November 19, 2024, Jorge Rivera (46) and Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino (45) were arrested after allegedly assaulting a School Resource Deputy at Deltona Middle School in Deltona, Florida. According to the Volusia County Sheriff's Office, the deputy was attempting to handle a situation involving the couple's child when the parents became combative. Body-worn camera footage reportedly shows a physical struggle. News coverage confirms multiple deputies responded to the scene, and video footage exists.

I am requesting the following records related to the incident involving Jorge Rivera and Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino at Deltona Middle School on the morning of November 19, 2024:

All body-worn camera footage from any deputies present at the scene.

All vehicle dash camera footage, including from initial responding units.

Any rear seat in-car camera footage if either suspect was detained in a patrol vehicle.

The complete incident report, arrest reports, and supplemental narratives.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to the following records related to the arrests of four individuals on January 10, 2025, following a vehicle pursuit that ended near the Providence/Cranston line on Interstate 95:

Body-worn camera footage from all Providence Police Department officers involved in the pursuit, apprehension, and arrest of the suspects.

Dashcam footage from all patrol units engaged in the pursuit and subsequent arrest operations.

Rear-seat vehicle footage from the patrol units that transported the suspects following their arrests.

Incident reports or arrest reports relating the incident.

This request focuses on essential records that document the pursuit, apprehension, and arrest of the suspects involved in the armed robbery of a FedEx driver in Harvard, Massachusetts, and the subsequent pursuit that concluded in Providence, Rhode Island. If any additional footage (such as surveillance or helicopter footage) exists and provides significant context to the events, I request access to those records as well.

If it helps to locate the desired incident, here's a news report: https://www.wpri.com/news/local-news/providence/bodycam-video-shows-arrest-of-4-suspects-in-fedex-driver-robbery/

title: Request for Anonymized Custody-Related Family Court Case Records (2019–2024)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Request for Anonymized Custody-Related Family Court Case Records (2019–2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern,

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Cal. Gov. Code §§ 6250–6270), I respectfully request anonymized, individual-level case data for all family court cases involving custody determinations filed and/or decided between January 1, 2019, and December 31, 2024.

Specifically, I am requesting data for the following case types:

- Divorce cases involving minor children
- Custody-only cases
- Parentage/paternity cases
- Custody or visitation modification cases

For each case, please provide the following individual-level fields, with all names and personal identifiers removed or masked:

Case-Level Fields:
- Anonymized case ID
- Case type
- Filing and decision dates
- Presiding judge
- Custody-related outcomes or final orders
- Party-Level Fields (for each party):
- Role in case (e.g., petitioner/respondent, mother/father)
- Race/ethnicity
- Gender
- Age or age band (e.g., 20–29, 30–39)
- ZIP code or census tract
- Whether the party was represented by an attorney
- Name of Attorney (if represented)
- Monthly income or income bracket (if available)
- Employment status (if available)
- Whether the party applied for a fee waiver or public assistance

Additional Requested Documents:
- Copies or structured data extracted from Income & Expense Declarations (FL-150 forms) filed in these cases, with personal identifiers and sensitive data redacted

I request that the records be provided in a machine-readable format, such as CSV, Excel, or JSON.

This request is part of a personal, independent research initiative examining patterns in family court custody decisions. I intend to conduct a public interest analysis, which may be shared with academic institutions or legal organizations for potential collaboration or peer review. 

If some fields cannot be disclosed due to privacy concerns, I am open to receiving anonymized proxies or redacted versions that retain analytical value.

If fulfilling the request in full is not possible, I welcome a discussion on narrowing the scope. Please notify me of any costs before processing. I also request a waiver of fees under Cal. Gov. Code § 6253(e), as this request is in the public interest and not for commercial use.

If there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I prefer the request to be filled out electronically, by e-mail attachment if available, or by secure download link.

Thank you for your time and assistance. I look forward to your response within the timeframe allowed by law.

Sincerely,
A member of the public
(sent via MuckRock)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: University of North Texas: Lawmakers' objectsion to "I Bear Witness" display (University Of North Texas)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any communications received, sent, or created by or for Chancellor Michael Williams, President Harrison Keller, Regent Laura Wright, Steve Moore, or any person employed by the University of North Texas System Office of Government Relations, which either:

(a) concerns the "I Bear Witness" art exhibit in the Student Union (including opposition by lawmakers, the public, or others to the exhibit), as referenced at https://www.keranews.org/news/2025-03-05/lawmakers-demand-unt-remove-student-art-exhibit-on-palestinian-conflict-claiming-antisemitism; or

(b) contains any of the following terms: "Executive Order", GA-44, GA44, Israel, Palestine, Palestinian, Israeli, Gaza, anti-semitic, antisemitic, anti-Israel, Muslim, Title VI, IHRA, propaganda, genocide, exhibit, First Amendment, free speech, freedom of speech, freedom of expression, Mitch Little, Jared Patterson, Richard Hayes, Andy Hopper, or Ben Bumgarner; or

(c) was sent to or received from one or more of the following lawmakers, their offices, or their aides: Mitch Little, Jared Patterson, Richard Hayes, Andy Hopper, or Ben Bumgarner.

These requests are limited to records generated on or after February 15, 2025.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, instant messages, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication. "Communications" also includes transcripts, videos, audio, minutes, notes, or other recordings of conversations, meetings, phone calls, or Zoom (or similar) meetings.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request. 

Finally, please also note that this request does not seek records held by any student, student organization, or faculty member. Any search should be limited to records held by staff, administrators, or other non-faculty (and non-student) employees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. In any litigation before a federal district court on behalf of the United States or any agency, department, official, or employee thereof, any letter sent by your attorneys containing any of the following terms: 
a. "Federal Rule of Civil Procedure 11"
b. "Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, Rule 11"
c. "FRCP 11"
d. "Fed. R. Civ. P. 11"

title: Library Contract Request: ACS Journals at San Diego State University

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Library Contract Request: ACS Journals at San Diego State University
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent governing, base, or master license with the American Chemical Society (ACS) relating to the licensing of ACS Journals;
All related amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with ACS for journal licensing. Responsive materials include invoices, order forms, and any other documents that incorporate language governing terms of use of the ACS Journals.

If you contend that any portion of the records requested is exempt from disclosure by express provisions of law, Government Code § 7922.525(b) requires segregation and redaction of that material in order that the remainder of the records may be released. If you contend that any express provision of law exists to exempt from disclosure all or a portion of the records I have requested, Government Code § 7922.535 requires that you notify me of the reasons for the determination not later than 10 days from your receipt of this request. Government Code § 7922.540 requires that any response to this request that includes a determination that the request is denied, in whole or in part, must be in writing and include the name and title of the person(s) responsible for the institution’s response.

I am affiliated with an educational research institution; this request is made for a scholarly purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

mo

title: Illinois State University-Normal Library's ScienceDirect license agreement

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Illinois State University-Normal Library's ScienceDirect license agreement
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (5 ILCS 140), I hereby request the following records:

1. Most recent governing, base, or master license with Elsevier, a subsidiary of RELX, relating to the product ScienceDirect.
2. All related amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, letters of intent.
3. All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with Elsevier’s ScienceDirect. Responsive materials include invoices, order forms, and any other documents that incorporate language governing terms of use of the ScienceDirect product.

Please do not limit your search to strictly direct agreements or renewals between the institution and Elsevier, but include all agreements and related documentation through consortia such as the Consortium of Academic and Research Libraries in Illinois (CARLI) or Lyrasis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com.  I am affiliated with an educational research institution; this request is made for a scholarly purpose and not for a commercial use.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
ekkd

title: File Request

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: File Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All investigative reports, hearing transcripts, recorded interviews, and other written materials pertaining to investigation and decisions of the SEC into Country World Casinos, Inc.

Country World Casinos, Inc., was an entity created to develop a casino in Black Hawk, Colorado in the early 1990s. 

According to SEC filings and other open source material, the SEC opened an investigation into Country World Casinos, Inc. in about 1994 and closed it several years later. 

From a quartly filing of CWC in August 1996:

"In the fiscal year ended June 30, 1994, the Company was informed by the Securities and Exchange Commission (the "SEC") that the SEC had instituted a formal order of investigation concerning the possibility of violations of the federal securities laws by the Company. In August 1996, the Company was advised that the investigation had been terminated and that, at this time, no enforcement action has been recommended by the staff of the SEC."

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is very much in the public interest. The requested documents will be processed for the purpose of news gathering, as I am a freelance journalist.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. 

It is very much appreciated.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely,

C. Collins

title: Special Government Employee appointments and detailing agreements for staff to/from other agencies to Social Security Administration in February 2025

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Special Government Employee appointments and detailing agreements for staff to/from other agencies to Social Security Administration in February 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In the testimony of Florence Felix-Lawson (https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.dcd.277150/gov.uscourts.dcd.277150.53.1.pdf) she references 10 staffers who were either appointed as Special Government Employees or detailed to Social Security Agency from other agencies:

"On February 13, 2025, Employee 1, a software engineer, was appointed as an expert, special government employee under 5 U.S.C. § 3109 and 5 C.F.R. Part 304. 42 U.S.C. § 904(a)(2) further supports his appointment and states that the Commissioner of Social Security “may procure services of experts and consultants in accordance with the
provisions of section 3109 of title 5.” His duties currently relate to improper payments and SSA’s Death Master File (records maintained by SSA on deceased individuals). SSA is currently working with the Small Business Administration (SBA) to effectuate an interagency agreement for Employee 1 to be detailed temporarily to SBA. 

"On February 18, 2025, we began onboarding and training Employee 3, a Schedule C Policy Advisor, detailed from the Department of Labor to SSA. The agreement finalizing his onboarding is dated February 22, 2025. His duties currently relate to improper payments and SSA’s Death Master File (containing information about decedents from SSA records). 

"On February 18, 2025, we began onboarding and training Employee 5, an engineer, detailed from the United States DOGE Service to SSA. The agreement finalizing his
onboarding is an Interagency Agreement with U.S. Digital Service (now U.S. DOGE Service) covering Fiscal Year 2025, which was amended February 20, 2025 to recognize the change to U.S. DOGE Service; extend the duration to July 4, 2026; and modify and supplement certain terms in the original agreement. The agreement authorizes work to include, but does not limit work to, increasing efficiency and the modernization of SSA IT infrastructure and systems, detecting waste, fraud, and abuse. 

"On February 18, 2025, we began onboarding and training Employee 2, Senior Advisor (Program Specialist AD-0301-00). He is in the process of being detailed from National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) to SSA. The agency is waiting on final signature on the interagency detail agreement from NASA. His duties currently include serving as the DOGE lead at SSA

"On February 19, 2025, Employee 10, a software engineer, was detailed from the Office of the Administrator at the General Services Administration to SSA. His duties currently include supporting the leadership team with the assessment and enhancement of internal processes and operational procedures, specifically, focusing on identifying inefficiencies and areas for improvement and ensuring that the administrative and programmatic functions align with the best practices for effectiveness and accountability. 

"On February 26, 2025, Employee 8, an engineer, was detailed from Office of Personnel Management to SSA. His duties currently relate to improper payments and death data.

"On February 27, 2025, Employees 4, 6, and 9 were each appointed as an expert, special government employee under 5 U.S.C. § 3109 and 5 C.F.R. Part 304. 42 U.S.C. §904(a)(2) further supports their appointment and states that the Commissioner of Social Security “may procure services of experts and consultants in accordance with the provisions of section 3109 of title 5.” All three of these individuals’ duties currently relate to improper payments and death data.

"On March 5, 2025, the agency began onboarding Employee 7, as a detailee from Department of Labor (DOL) to SSA. The agency is waiting on final signatures on the interagency detail agreement from DOL. His duties currently relate to improper payments. 

I would like to request the following information:
1. For the SGEs, I would like to receive whatever publicly shareable details can be made of their appointments, including if they signed SF-61s
2. For the detailees, I would like to see their detailing agreements made with the other agency governing the scope of work and who they report to, etc.
3. For the SGE potentially being detailed to the Small Business Administration, I would like to see that agreement
4. I would like to request "Signed Acknowledgements of SSA Information Security and Privacy Awareness Training, which covers requirements for compliance with information security and privacy policies of SSA." for both the SGEs and detailees.

I expect the timespan for this inquiry to be in February 2025, but it does seem like there might be a pre-existing USDS detailing arrangemnt for Employee 5. I would prefer for documentation to include identities, since these individuals are government employees carrying out public services in an non-classified environment, but if those need to be redacted, I would still prefer to see the documentation of these detailing arrangements and SGE appointments where applicable. Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Harris

title: Frederick C. Leonard Sr. (National Archives and Records Administration - Northeast Region, Boston)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Frederick C. Leonard Sr. (National Archives and Records Administration - Northeast Region, Boston)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning or describing Frederick C. Leonard Sr. Born Feb. 9, 1892; died Nov. 21, 1959.

The late Mr. Leonard was a decorated veteran who attended former President Eisenhower's Inauguration Ball.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that NARA has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request: Frederick C. Leonard Sr. (National Archives and Records Administration - Northeast Region, Boston)
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the National Archives at Boston 

Inquiries will be responded to in the order that they are received. We will be assigning your request to a staff member who will contact you with a more substantive response. Due to the number of reference requests received and the limitation of staff time available please allow for 10-15 business days for an answer 

Our research room is open on a limited basis. Research visits are by appointment only. You may email boston.archives@nara.gov to request an appointment. 

Please monitor our web page https://www.archives.gov/boston for details and updates.
